children.encoding:
(always (and 
  (= (n_refuel plane2) 0)
  (= (n_refuel plane3) 0)
  (forall (?c1 - city ?c2 - city) 
    (and (= (n_flyslow plane2 ?c1 ?c2) 0)
         (= (n_flyfast plane2 ?c1 ?c2) 0)
         (= (n_flyslow plane3 ?c1 ?c2) 0)
         (= (n_flyfast plane3 ?c1 ?c2) 0)))
  (forall (?p - person ?c - city)
    (and (= (n_board ?p plane2 ?c) 0)
         (= (n_debark ?p plane2 ?c) 0)
         (= (n_board ?p plane3 ?c) 0)
         (= (n_debark ?p plane3 ?c) 0)))
))

<documents>
<pddl_domain>
;; Enrico Scala (enricos83@gmail.com) and Miquel Ramirez (miquel.ramirez@gmail.com)
(define (domain zenotravel)
        ;(:requirements :typing :fluents)
        (:types
                locatable city - object
                aircraft person - locatable
        )
        (:predicates
                (located ?x - locatable ?c - city)
                (in ?p - person ?a - aircraft)
        )
        (:functions
                (fuel ?a - aircraft)
                (distance ?c1 - city ?c2 - city)
                (slow-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (fast-burn ?a - aircraft)
                (capacity ?a - aircraft)
                (total-fuel-used)
                (onboard ?a - aircraft)
                (zoom-limit ?a - aircraft)

                (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)
        )

        (:action board
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?p ?c)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (located ?p ?c))
                        (in ?p ?a)
                        (increase (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_board ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action debark
                :parameters (?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
                :precondition (and (in ?p ?a)
                        (located ?a ?c))
                :effect (and (not (in ?p ?a))
                        (located ?p ?c)
                        (decrease (onboard ?a) 1)
                        (increase (n_debark ?p ?a ?c) 1))
        )

        (:action flyslow
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a))))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total-fuel-used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (slow-burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyslow ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action flyfast
                :parameters (?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
                :precondition (and (located ?a ?c1)
                        (>= (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (<= (onboard ?a) (zoom-limit ?a)))
                :effect (and (not (located ?a ?c1))
                        (located ?a ?c2)
                        (increase
                                (total-fuel-used)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (decrease
                                (fuel ?a)
                                (* (distance ?c1 ?c2) (fast-burn ?a)))
                        (increase (n_flyfast ?a ?c1 ?c2) 1))
        )

        (:action refuel
                :parameters (?a - aircraft)
                :precondition (and (> (capacity ?a) (fuel ?a))

                )
                :effect (and (assign (fuel ?a) (capacity ?a))
                        (increase (n_refuel ?a) 1))
        )

)
</pddl_domain>
<pddl_problem>
(define (problem ZTRAVEL-3-10)
(:domain zenotravel)
(:objects
	plane1 - aircraft
	plane2 - aircraft
	plane3 - aircraft
	person1 - person
	person2 - person
	person3 - person
	person4 - person
	person5 - person
	person6 - person
	person7 - person
	person8 - person
	person9 - person
	person10 - person
	city0 - city
	city1 - city
	city2 - city
	city3 - city
	city4 - city
	city5 - city
	)
(:init
	(located plane1 city4)
	(= (capacity plane1) 2326)
	(= (fuel plane1) 205)
	(= (slow-burn plane1) 1)
	(= (fast-burn plane1) 2)
	(= (onboard plane1) 0)
	(= (zoom-limit plane1) 10)
	(located plane2 city2)
	(= (capacity plane2) 12132)
	(= (fuel plane2) 1469)
	(= (slow-burn plane2) 4)
	(= (fast-burn plane2) 9)
	(= (onboard plane2) 0)
	(= (zoom-limit plane2) 9)
	(located plane3 city3)
	(= (capacity plane3) 5204)
	(= (fuel plane3) 1532)
	(= (slow-burn plane3) 2)
	(= (fast-burn plane3) 7)
	(= (onboard plane3) 0)
	(= (zoom-limit plane3) 8)
	(located person1 city1)
	(located person2 city2)
	(located person3 city1)
	(located person4 city4)
	(located person5 city5)
	(located person6 city1)
	(located person7 city0)
	(located person8 city2)
	(located person9 city1)
	(located person10 city5)
	(= (distance city0 city0) 0)
	(= (distance city0 city1) 619)
	(= (distance city0 city2) 565)
	(= (distance city0 city3) 886)
	(= (distance city0 city4) 596)
	(= (distance city0 city5) 766)
	(= (distance city1 city0) 619)
	(= (distance city1 city1) 0)
	(= (distance city1 city2) 561)
	(= (distance city1 city3) 756)
	(= (distance city1 city4) 760)
	(= (distance city1 city5) 980)
	(= (distance city2 city0) 565)
	(= (distance city2 city1) 561)
	(= (distance city2 city2) 0)
	(= (distance city2 city3) 657)
	(= (distance city2 city4) 702)
	(= (distance city2 city5) 639)
	(= (distance city3 city0) 886)
	(= (distance city3 city1) 756)
	(= (distance city3 city2) 657)
	(= (distance city3 city3) 0)
	(= (distance city3 city4) 546)
	(= (distance city3 city5) 510)
	(= (distance city4 city0) 596)
	(= (distance city4 city1) 760)
	(= (distance city4 city2) 702)
	(= (distance city4 city3) 546)
	(= (distance city4 city4) 0)
	(= (distance city4 city5) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city0) 766)
	(= (distance city5 city1) 980)
	(= (distance city5 city2) 639)
	(= (distance city5 city3) 510)
	(= (distance city5 city4) 850)
	(= (distance city5 city5) 0)
	(= (total-fuel-used) 0)
)
(:goal (and
	(located plane1 city4)
	(located person1 city4)
	(located person2 city5)
	(located person3 city4)
	(located person4 city0)
	(located person5 city2)
	(located person6 city3)
	(located person8 city0)
	(located person9 city3)
	(located person10 city4)
	))

(:metric minimize (total-fuel-used))





)
</pddl_problem>
</documents> 

<information>
The user will give as input a natural language constraint that must be translated into PDDL3.0. The translation will be used by a PDDL planner.
</information>

<instructions> 
- Translate the input constraint into correct PDDL3.0.
- The resulting PDDL3.0 constraint must capture the same meaning as the initial input constraint.
- Remember that PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based. They can only refer to existing precates and fluents, thus, not to actions.
- Be sure to include temporal logic like operators in your translation.
- Format your answer such as there is no preambule and such that the PDDL translation is between the tags <pddl> and </pddl>.
</instructions>

<user_input>
Plane2 and plane3 should never perform an action
</user_input>

The user wants me to translate "Plane2 and plane3 should never perform an action" into PDDL3.0 constraint. 

Let me think about this. The constraint is saying that plane2 and plane3 should never perform any action. 

In PDDL3.0, constraints are state-based and can only refer to existing predicates and fluents, not to actions directly. However, I need to think about what it means for a plane to "never perform an action".

Looking at the domain, the actions that planes can perform are:
1. board (involving a plane as parameter)
2. debark (involving a plane as parameter) 
3. flyslow (involving a plane as parameter)
4. flyfast (involving a plane as parameter)
5. refuel (involving a plane as parameter)

Since I can't directly reference actions in PDDL3.0 constraints, I need to think about the effects of these actions and constrain the state in a way that would prevent these actions from being executed.

However, there's another approach. The domain has some numeric fluents that track the number of times certain actions are performed:
- (n_board ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
- (n_debark ?p - person ?a - aircraft ?c - city)
- (n_flyslow ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
- (n_flyfast ?a - aircraft ?c1 ?c2 - city)
- (n_refuel ?a - aircraft)

These are counters that get incremented each time the corresponding action is performed. So I can constrain these to always be 0 for plane2 and plane3.

Wait, let me think about this more carefully. The constraint is "Plane2 and plane3 should never perform an action". This is a temporal constraint that should hold throughout the entire execution.

In PDDL3.0, I can use the "always" temporal operator to express that something should hold throughout the entire plan execution.
 
I'll carefully track the numeric fluents for these planes. The constraint requires ensuring zero activity across multiple action types. I'll need to create a comprehensive constraint that covers all potential action counters for plane2 and plane3, making sure their involvement in any action remains consistently zero throughout the entire plan execution.

The key is to use the "always" temporal operator with conditions that prevent any incrementation of action counters for these specific planes. This approach will effectively prevent plane2 and plane3 from participating in any actions during the entire plan.

I'll need to construct precise PDDL constraints that cover flying, refueling, boarding, and disembarking actions for these two planes, ensuring their complete inactivity across all possible city pairs and with any potential passengers.

For flight actions, I'll specify zero-count constraints for both slow and fast flights across every possible city combination. Refueling actions will also be restricted to zero occurrences. Similarly, boarding and disembarking constraints will prevent any movement for these specific planes.

The challenge is creating explicit constraints without universal quantification, which means manually specifying each potential city pair and passenger interaction to maintain zero counts for planes 2 and 3.

I'll need to enumerate specific city and person combinations systematically to ensure no actions can occur for these planes. This approach requires carefully listing out all potential interactions to prevent any possible movement or action.

I'm considering multiple constraint strategies: limiting fuel, restricting passenger movement, or preventing location changes. Each method has potential drawbacks in being too restrictive or overly specific.

The PDDL3.0 "always" operator offers a precise way to define constraints throughout plan execution. By specifying zero refueling and blocking potential city-to-city movements, I can effectively neutralize plane2 and plane3's capabilities without completely eliminating their existence in the problem domain.

I'll focus on creating explicit constraints that prevent any meaningful actions for these planes, ensuring they remain inactive without removing them entirely from the planning scenario.

The constraints systematically block refueling, flying, boarding, and debarking for both plane2 and plane3 across all possible city and person combinations. By setting each predicate's count to zero, I'm effectively rendering these planes completely immobilized without technically removing them from the problem domain.

This approach provides a precise way to constrain plane2 and plane3's potential actions, ensuring they cannot participate in any meaningful transportation or movement during the planning process. This constraint guarantees that plane2 and plane3 remain completely inactive throughout the entire plan, with all their action counters consistently set to zero across different cities and for all persons.

Looking at this constraint, I need to prevent plane2 and plane3 from performing any actions throughout the plan execution. Since PDDL3.0 constraints are state-based and cannot directly reference actions, I'll use the action counter fluents that are defined in the domain to ensure these planes never perform any actions.

The domain includes counter fluents for each action type:
- n_refuel for refueling actions
- n_flyslow and n_flyfast for flight actions  
- n_board and n_debark for passenger boarding/debarking actions

<pddl>
(always (and 
  (= (n_refuel plane2) 0)
  (= (n_refuel plane3) 0)
  (forall (?c1 - city ?c2 - city) 
    (and (= (n_flyslow plane2 ?c1 ?c2) 0)
         (= (n_flyfast plane2 ?c1 ?c2) 0)
         (= (n_flyslow plane3 ?c1 ?c2) 0)
         (= (n_flyfast plane3 ?c1 ?c2) 0)))
  (forall (?p - person ?c - city)
    (and (= (n_board ?p plane2 ?c) 0)
         (= (n_debark ?p plane2 ?c) 0)
         (= (n_board ?p plane3 ?c) 0)
         (= (n_debark ?p plane3 ?c) 0)))
))
</pddl>
